poem:
The Arithmetic of Warmth

In the winter's heavy coat,
figures shiver, numbers snowball,
pensioners prick their ears
to the draught of monetary might.
A pound saved is less heat
under blankets, less light
in the shadowy halls
where promises draft promises,
leaving us to count,
once more,
the invisible arithmetic of warmth.
